basics.name: Jie Huang
basics.summary: Master student at the Institute of Computing Technology, Chinese Academy of Sciences. Research focuses on Computer Vision and Vision-Language Models.

work.summary: Contributed to the development of Qwen3-VL, participating in multimodal positional encoding research and model training.

education.institution: Institute of Computing Technology, Chinese Academy of Sciences
Huazhong University of Science and Technology

publications.name: Qwen3-VL Technical Report
publications.summary: The most capable vision-language model in the Qwen series.

publications.name: Revisiting Multimodal Positional Encoding in Vision-Language Models
publications.summary: Comprehensive analysis of multimodal RoPE in VLMs. Accepted by ICLR 2026.

publications.name: RefHCM: A Unified Model for Referring Perceptions in Human-Centric Scenarios
publications.summary: A unified framework for human-centric referring perception tasks. Accepted by TMM 2025.

publications.name: Stealthy and Effective Physical Adversarial Attacks in Autonomous Driving
publications.publisher: IEEE Transactions on Information Forensics and Security (TIFS)
publications.summary: Physical adversarial attack methods targeting perception systems in autonomous driving. Accepted by TIFS 2024.
